LocaleResource.Name: Plugins.NopAcceleratePlus.Core.Body.EmailFormat
LocaleResource.Value:
Dear %Administration.Name%,

This is an automated notice that Solr Instance for your Store %Store.Name%-%Store.URL% is down. That means, that your nopCommerce store Search and Faceted navigation on Catalog & Search Pages will cease to work correctly. Don't worry, the pages will still work but instead of Solr's index, the requests will be served by nopCommerce default methods from SQL Server.

We urge you to look into this on urgent basis and start the Solr. Once you verify its working, just restart your store.

For more details on how to start Solr, please check our support documentation.

Best Regards,

nopAccelerate Team
www.nopAccelerate.com

LocaleResource.Name: Plugins.NopAcceleratePlus.Core.Field.URLDescription
LocaleResource.Value:
Ideally one should also block crawlers access to pages where facets are applied as it may result into duplicate content warning.There are two ways to do the same.

1. Configuring URL Parameters in Google Webmaster Tool's URL Parameter Tool and specify how these parameters affect the page and whether to crawl it or not. Please refer to  this document and this to understand how it impacts. Here is a good video that talks about Configuring URL Parameters in Webmaster Tools .

2. Disallow specific URL parameters using robots.txt. Make sure you're not blocking access to Search results as they may help you create a great landing pages. Please refer to page this for details on how to configure this.

We strongly recommend using the URL Parameter Tool to configure the same. However, it is best to talk to your SEO consultant for advise.

Also note that, we have already added rel=nofollow by default into the facet links to instruct crawlers not to follow dynamic links generated by facets combination.

LocaleResource.Name: Plugins.NopAcceleratePlus.Solr.WizardSetUp.Message.Step.BasicSolrSetup.Content
LocaleResource.Value:
The nopAccelerate Plus enhances nopCommerce by integrating it with Apache Solr, the popular, blazing-fast, open source enterprise search platform built on Apache Lucene and is highly reliable, scalable and fault tolerant and more. Solr powers the search and navigation features of many of the world's largest internet sites.

A Solr core is a uniquely named, managed, and configured index running in a Solr server; a Solr server can host one or more cores. nopAccelerate Plus uses a Solr Core to index data from nopCommerce database, which is then used to perform search and navigation query instead of SQL Server. A single Solr Core is sufficient for one nopCommerce site with multiple languages, currency or stores.

You can host Solr on same Server which is hosting your web app. If you are on Windows VM or VPS, you can install Solr on the same server. If you are using cloud app server like Azure Web App Service, you will need to host Solr separately on Azure VM or use our cloud Solr Hosting Service

You will have better speed and one click Solr core integration if your nopCommerce and Solr is on same server.

LocaleResource.Value:
Before we proceed with Solr Core Configurations, there is one step you need to perform manually on your remotely hosted Solr Core.

Click Download SolrSetup Zip button then Zip foler is download for Setting up Solr. Copy db-data-config.xml and solrconfig.xml and then paste them in Conf folder of Solr Core then reload Core From Admin Panel of Core

Please check the C:\solr-7.5.0\contrib\dataimporthandler\lib And check that sqljdbc42.jar file exist or not...if not then Copy the Jar File from Zip Folder and paste at C:\solr-7.5.0\contrib\dataimporthandler\lib

After successfully doing upper steps please click on Update DbFile on Solr button. It will Checked the Second Option(Database Configuration files Sets properly) and then Click on retry Button to again Setup the Solr

LocaleResource.Name: Plugins.NopAcceleratePlus.Solr.WizardSetUp.Message.Step.SolrConfiguration.Content.RemoteFailed
LocaleResource.Value:
Oops! There is something wrong. Please follow the instructions.

Please download the 'RemoteCoreSetupFiles.zip' which contains the files required to be copied at your remotely hosted Solr directory.

Copy db-data-config.xml, solrconfig.xml and synonyms.txt and paste them at Conf folder of your Solr Data Directory. Once done, please Reload the Core from Solr Admin.

Before we connect to SQL Server database from Solr, we need to install Microsoft JDBC Driver into Solr. To do the same, please copy sqljdbc42.jar file from the 'RemoteCoreSetupFiles.zip' and paste it at Solr's lib folder for dataimporthandler. On Windows it should be at C:\solr-7.5.0\contrib\dataimporthandler\lib. Please create folder if its not there already.

If you're using a Solr hosting service, please share above instruction with their support team to do the needful.

Once above steps are performed, please press 'Check DB Config' button to verify the same. Once it's passed, press Retry button to proceed further wih Setup.

LocaleResource.Value:
The nopAccelerate Plus enhances nopCommerce by integrating it with Apache Solr. But first Solr will need data to be index into it. We have configured Solr to read directly from SQL Server using Solr's DIH features. Relax, you don't need to worry about anything. This wizard gives you idea on how it works in the background.

The nopAccelerate Plus plugin automatically tracks any changes (using SQL Triggers) you made into nopCommerce entities like editing a product or category, and updates the NopAcc_Plus_Incremental_Solr_Product. This table stores indexing status of the entities. We have already installed a Scheduled Task into nopCommerce, which will keep executing DIH automatically in the background at every one hour by default. You can change the frequency by changing directly into the Scheduled Task in nopCommerce.

You can also start indexing manually using 'Start Indexing' button on nopAccelerate Plus Configure page.

Note that first indexing will take time as it will need to crate a full index. Once its done, subsequent changes are really faster. And you can monitor the Indexing Status on our Configure page.

The indexing will be executed into smaller batches, where it will fetch defined number of entities in one go from SQL and index into Solr. Depending on the size of your nopCommerce database, full indexing will take some time. A default batch size is 500 products which is good for most stores, however you can experiment with different value.

Once indexing is completed, please enable the features from setting page to improve the user experience of your store.

nopAccelerate Theme Compatibility

The plugin uses your active theme's view templates, so it should be compatible with most themes and plugins. If not, try switching to default theme and disabling plugins to find out which plugin is not compatible. As per our experience those plugins will not work which overrides the Catalog Services or Catalog Controller, as our plugin does the same.

The plugin uses its own view templates for Facet Filters. It is designed elgantly, and should work well with all third party themes. However, to match it perfectly you may need to apply your own styles. Or you can hire our team to do the same for you.

To install Solr, check the System Requirements(https://lucene.apache.org/solr/guide/7_0/solr-system-requirements.html) and complete the Solr installation using the Solr installation guide (here). Note that the plugin supports the remotely hosted Solr instance, however the installation support for remotely hosted Solr instance is not included as part of standard product support and you may need to buy it separately if you want our team to do it for you.

Once done, please make sure that your Solr instance is accessible from your Web App Server. You may need to create a firewall rule to open connection to Solr if its not accessible.

Once your Solr is up, please create a new Solr Core and give us Solr Core URL below:
